Comments_List: One primary thing I learned was about the standard resources for epigraphic work.
Facility with Old Aramaic script and language, as well as basic familiarity with the corpus of inscriptions in that dialect.
I feel that I have a working understanding of the grammar of the language, as well as some of the typical forms that early inscriptions.
More grammatical resources would be useful. The opportunity to work with real inscriptions (at least in pictures) was a benefit.
Selection and variety of inscriptions was good. Discussion of epigraphic and paleographic issues was good. Could use a bit more discussion of grammatical issues and topics.

A strength of the course was the way that we went through the inscriptions, usually word by word, to discuss the meaning and significance.  Going through the grammar like this is helpful for me to understand how the grammatical aspects work in context. 
I do think that the class could initially benefit from either a grammar text book, or some references to early grammar/how it changes throughout time.
